result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: DA's request for certified copies

Defendant Robert J Ellifritz in court.  Attorney Preston James Smead in court for Robert J Ellifritz.  Prosecuting attorney Andrew Herrmann in court for the State of Wisconsin. Minutes filed.
Motion hearing scheduled for November 18, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Further proceedings on October 7, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
State's Brief in Support of Other Acts Motion
Motion to Introduce Other Acts Evidence
State's Brief in Support of Motion to Amend Information
Motion to Amend Information

Prosecuting attorney J J. Crawford in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Robert J Ellifritz not in court.  Attorney Preston James Smead in court for Robert J Ellifritz. Defendant not present, ride issues. Trial dates set, cases joined for trial. Minutes filed.
Final pre-trial scheduled for January 18, 2023 at 11:00 am.
Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for February 2, 2023 at 09:00 am.

Prosecuting attorney Vivien L. TenHaken in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Robert J Ellifritz in court.  Attorney Preston James Smead in court for Robert J Ellifritz. Court inquired if victim wished to be heard; no statement made. Received offer. Victim has been given notice of hearing. Minutes filed.
Status conference scheduled for August 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Notice of Motion and Motion for Establishment of Discovery Deadlines.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Prosecutor

records.addlTxt: Scheduling Order will be provided to Attys via e-filing by the Court
with Exhibit #1 attached

3:04 PM (64-06) Defendant Robert J Ellifritz in court.  Attorney Preston James Smead in court for Robert J Ellifritz.  Attorney Samuel Thomas Berg in court for State of Wisconsin. 
State called to the stand as a witness, Officer Frank Fusco.
Frank Fusco duly sworn by the clerk and testified on direct examination by ADA Berg.
Witness identified defendant in court. Exhibit #1 marked, identified and discussed in court.
Exhibit #1 offered and received by the court.
3:11PM - Cross examination by Attorney Smead.
Evidence is closed.
3:21PM - Argument by ADA Berg. Requesting bind over.
3:26PM - Objection by Attorney Smead and gives argument.
Court finds probable cause that a felony has been committed and that the defendant likely committed it and binds him over to stand trial on the charges.
Attorney Smead acknowledged the information, waived reading and plead not guilty to all charges on behalf of his client.
Attorney Smead requests to keep the 06/24 hearing, although at 1:15PM not 8:30AM.
Court will set both files for June 24th at 1:15PM


Adj.  3:33PM

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
DEFENDANT MUST POST $1,200 CASH

BOND TO BE CO-SIGNED BY JENNETTE ELLIFRITZ

BOND TO COVER 22CF227 & 21CT438

Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol. Defendant shall not drive a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license. Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. Defendant will not possess any firearms, ammunition or other weapons. Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH J.L.E. (dob 9/12/1990) OR RESIDENCE. Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.

records.addlTxt:
Prosecuting attorney Vivien L. TenHaken in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Robert J Ellifritz in court, in custody by video. Attorney Renner appeared for Attorney Leah Selmek. Motion to modify bond by Attorney Renner. Argument, Granted. Bond to be amended. Attorney Renner disagrees with the charges. Victim not in court. Requests charges be changed by next hearing. Defendant given complaint; charges/penalties explained by the court. Time period waived for preliminary. Minutes filed.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 23, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Signed bond filed with the court.
Notice of Arrest

Viven TenHaken appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Robert J Ellifritz in court, in custody by video with Attorney Leah Selmek. Defendant has lengthy criminal history and pending charges in other counties. Minutes filed.
Hearing scheduled for April 19, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
